greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers k such that (5^p-3^p)/2 is prime, where p = prime(k).
comment: Next term is greater than 1000. - _Farideh Firoozbakht_, Oct 11 2006
mathematica: Do[If[PrimeQ[(5^Prime[n] - 3^Prime[n])/2], Print[n]], {n, 1000}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 12 2007 *)
results.author: _Alexander Adamchuk_, Oct 08 2006
ext: a(13)-a(16) computed from A121877 by _Jinyuan Wang_, Mar 23 2020
